page.title: 08BUILDINGS MUSEUM, BROMSGROVE
page.content:
The{oldest item}is the{Guesten Hall } roof,dating back to the 14thC, and the most recent addition a{Victorian earth {closet}from Leominster.There is a 19th century{Post Mill}now producing flour again, for sale in the town. Two old workshops have been erected displaying Bromsgrove's {nail and chain-making} industries, the crafts being regularly demonstrated.The most modern dwelling is a{"prefab"}- a single storey house, pre-fabricated during {World War 2}to enable people to be re-housed quickly after bombing, and to compensate for lack of building during that period. The dwelling contains all the furnish- ings and paraphernalia of the 1940's.
{Entrance fee}: Â£1.50 adult, 75p child. {Opening times:}10.30 a.m to 5.30 p.m
